dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Give him the BOLT-52.> I found the cartridge and deleted that data for you.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, yes. I'm going to be up all night with this. All those blanks waiting to be filled, boxes waiting to be ticked...

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: Try to control yourself, sir.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Have you any idea how powerful this is? Corporations have been toppled with less.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How exactly is a data cartridge going to help?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You made it sound like you were sending me after a weapon.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: What a question! Bureaucratic micromanagement is the only way anything gets done on Halcyon, and proper documentation is a key part of that.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: For our part, a Bill of Liquidation/Transfer Form-52 will protect our holdings on Monarch by temporarily assigning them to a pass-through entity once we drop our bomb on the Board.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Yes! Finally, the Board will get their comeuppance!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Spare me the details and just tell me what comes next.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Let me guess, a paperweight?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Sort of! Really, we're just going to blackmail them into offering us a seat at the table!

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: But, really, whatever gets you excited about the idea. It's definitely a firm middle finger.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I can get behind that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Just tell me what you're planning.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's what I like to hear.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I have reason to believe that one of the other corporations is operating on Monarch - illegally and in secret.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: If we can find proof, I can use that as leverage to... encourage certain powers that be to accept our BOLT-52 and reinstate us on the Board.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sanjar, you sly dog.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What does that mean for me?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: You really think so?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I admit, I've been hatching this scheme for quite some time. I just needed someone capable to help me carry it out.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: If someone is operating here, then Catherine's almost certainly supplying them out of Fallbrook. Perhaps she could be convinced to tell you where they are.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I know how to make people talk.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sounds like you know her well enough yourself.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, I imagine you do.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: But as much as I love your can-do attitude and dangerous gravitas, Catherine handles all of our shipments.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: So it would be best if you could "leave her in one piece." Is that how you people put it?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Close enough.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Watch it with the "you people."

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Once you, uh, subtly work out where this corporate facility might be, bring back proof of its operation. Maybe some nice letterhead. Or someone working there - that would do it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Infiltrate a secret corporate base and kidnap the staff. Sure, easy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm on it.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: A foolproof plan if I ever heard one! I'll leave the execution to you.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Hah! I knew you were the right person for the job. I suppose I'll leave you to it.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Of course. I didn't mean to make assumptions.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's part of the problem. She has certain... ambitions for Stellar Bay. And I fear my asking her would give her the leverage she's been looking for.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: Don't get yourself worked up, sir. It's perfectly natural to have a healthy fear of her.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: We really don't need to discuss this now, Celia.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So, go to Fallbrook and get the location of an illegal corporate facility. Then?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Corporate espionage.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: How was that, Celia? Did I sell it?

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: Your best delivery yet, sir.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You killed it, Sanjar.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Just get on with it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: It kinda spoils the effect if you have to ask.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Celia...

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: Already noted for your review, sir.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So, this plan of yours?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Getting ahead of myself again.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: Happens to the best of us, sir.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: See, that doesn't even make sense. This is an electronic form. We don't need paperweights.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hardly the point, sir.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If you could kill rapts half as well as you kill a good joke, you wouldn't need me.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: Perhaps you should explain the second part of the plan, sir.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: But that's exactly what this is! The world isn't changed with guns and speeches - much as Graham and his followers would like to think - but rather with meticulous documentation.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: And the Bill of Liquidation/Transfer Form-52 is one of the most formidable pieces of data entry in all of Halcyon. One false stroke can invalidate the entire document.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: It's true. One of the old execs gave herself a stroke trying to fill out the exemptions section.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What does the BOLT-52 do, exactly?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The pen really is mightier.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Don't hurt yourself, I guess.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: How charmingly quaint! But this is an electronic form - no ink need be wasted.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: It's an expression, sir.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, it really shouldn't be. Electronic data is much easier to disseminate. But I digress.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Your concern is most touching. But not to worry - I've been preparing years for this.
